radiographic_examinations.findings: Mild scattered periventricular white-matter hyperintensities and a few chronic microhemorrhages.
Progression of white-matter abnormalities and development of white-matter edema, more pronounced in the temporal lobes.
No evidence of acute infarct or new hemorrhage.

radiographic_examinations.date: On last admission (12 days after discharge)
radiographic_examinations.findings: New punctate acute infarcts in the right temporal and left occipital lobes; partial resolution of previously described extensive abnormalities seen on T2-weighted imaging.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased number of microhemorrhages predominately in the occipital, posterior temporal, and parietal lobes.

radiographic_examinations.date: At the time of initial admission
radiographic_examinations.findings: Rounded opacity in the right apex measuring approximately 1.0 cm by 0.6 cm.

radiographic_examinations.date: At the time of initial admission
radiographic_examinations.findings: More extensive patchy white-matter hypoattenuation in the cerebral hemispheres, most pronounced in the temporal lobes.
